item.description:
Please bring balls, and don't forget water. I won't be doing organized stretches, but it's a good idea to do some before you hit the court.

Spring has sprung and it is time to get back outdoors! Join players of all levels as we work on our swing, serve, volleys, and other tennis skills. We are here to have fun and get back in the swing of things.

Braintree High School offers plenty of opportunity to play tennis on its 6 tennis courts and two practice backboards. Courts are available for up to 2 hours. The BHS Tennis Teams and those w/ permits have priority over residents who all have priority over non-residents.

*Please Note: This is NOT instructional. Therefore, you should have a basic knowledge of the game, how to use the racket, know the rules and know how to volley. Ideally, you should be at least a 2.0 NTRP Rating or Advanced Beginner.*

Spring Into Tennis!
SAT, April 24th, 2010 @10AM-12PM
Braintree High School Tennis Courts
128 Town Street
(Enter off Franklin St/Route 37)
Braintree, MA 02184

Meeting Place: Tennis courts

Event Organizer(s): Kay (will be wearing a grey sweatshirt). Chandra may be there, but not sure yet

Min/Max: Max of 14 people. We can rotate on and off the courts.

Guests: Welcome, 1 per member!

Ages: Normally our events are adults-only. However, if you have a child or relative who is 16+ they are welcome to attend this event.

Event Fees: None! We no longer charge event fees. If you would like to donate $, feel free to do so as it will go towards the monthly meet up fees that the organizer pays.

Directions: On the "Frequently Used Venues" Discussion Thread on the Message Board.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for me on the courts; will have grey sweatshirt

group.name: The South Shore Fitness Meetup Group

item.name: Saturday Tennis!
